description: The round payoff this round was 81. You, Kate chose to play option 1.John chose to play option 2. You received a payoff of 0.
John appears to favor choosing Option 2 as a strategy to potentially secure a larger individual payoff, even if it means the other player gets nothing.
Choosing Option 1 can lead to zero payoff if the other player selects Option 2, highlighting the risk of not coordinating actions.
The game incentivizes players to anticipate and adapt to the opponent's choices, as asymmetric decisions (one Option 1, one Option 2) create unequal outcomes.
Past rounds provide valuable data for future decisions, suggesting Kate should consider varying her strategy to avoid repeated losses.
